intro: Brachyscome graminea, commonly known as the common everlasting or silver everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Brachyscome graminea is often used in ornamental gardening for its drought tolerance and attractive floral display.
